oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 2DV RANS-VOF MODELLING OF DEPTHS AND VELOCITIES OF OVERTOPPING WAVES AT OVERWASHED DIKES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Raosa, Andrea Natalia
Zanuttigh, Barbara
Lopez Lara, Javier
Hughes, Steven
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: overwashed dikes
real wave overtopping
numerical simulations
experiments
RANS-VOF model
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The purpose of this contribution is the representation of real wave overtopping over sea dikes with the Rans-Vof code (IH-2VOF) developed by the University of Cantabria. More specific objectives are: to identify the real capacity of the IH-2VOF model in the prediction of overflow and to determinate the accuracy of these predictions in order to provide designers with a generally applicable methodology to use the code. The model is validated against experimental tests conducted by Hughes at the U.S. Army Engineer Research and Development Center (ERDC). This analysis shows that the model tends to overestimate wave reflection and better results are obtained by introducing a porous layer around the structure as artificial way to reduce reflected wave energy.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; waves.62
